intro: Oldenlandia monanthos, commonly known as the single-flower spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and clusters of small, white or pale blue flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its leaves are opposite, oval-shaped, and have a slightly hairy texture. Oldenlandia monanthos is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
